name: Empanadas de Jamon, Queso, y Huevo Duro (Ham, Cheese, and Hard-boiled Egg Empanadas)
author: Fioa
summary: These are my easy to-make delicious empanadas when I am in a hurry, and of course, they are my kids' favorite!  Gouda, hard-boiled eggs, and ham empanadas are light and full of flavor, a perfect easy midweek Mediterranean dinner.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
Grease 2 baking sheets with cooking spray
Combine ham, Gouda cheese, and hard-boiled eggs in a bowl; mix well
Arrange pastry disks on a flat surface; dab a little water around the rims
Place a large tablespoonful of ham and cheese mixture in the center; fold pastry over and press edge with a fork to seal well
Place empanadas on the prepared baking sheets
Bake in the preheated oven until golden, 20 to 25 minutes
Let cool for 5 minutes before serving
